We spoke to 10 National Guardsmen who have taken part  in the protest response across the U.S. since the killing of George Floyd.

Many felt uncomfortable with the way they were used to handle the unrest because demonstrators lumped them in with the police

name: politico
text: For the record, this replaces a deleted tweet with an inaccurate description of the Guardsmen's role in controlling protests

name: politico
text: Five states held primaries yesterday, but long lines and a surge of mail ballots made for a slow vote count â€” especially in Georgia https://t.co/kZJEViQULA

name: politico
text: The voting issues and delays in reporting results provided a potential preview of the November general election under pandemic rules https://t.co/kZJEViQULA

name: politico
text: The most consequential race in Georgia was the Democratic Senate primary. Jon Ossoff entered as the frontrunner, but as of this morning, it's unclear whether he had won a majority of the votes cast, teetering on the threshold necessary to avoid a runoff https://t.co/R939DP9vZA https://t.co/PjEBOvrtfu

name: politico
text: Voters also went to the polls yesterday in four other states: South Carolina, West Virginia, North Dakota and Nevada. We've got a roundup of results here ðŸ‘‡https://t.co/R9o8LMdKUk

name: politico
text: As President Trump leans on religion to reconnect with his political base ahead of the November election, most Americans dismiss the notion that he himself is a man of faith https://t.co/8J4BuEauhH

name: politico
text: Only 27 percent of registered voters in a new POLITICO/Morning Consult poll said they somewhat or strongly agree that Trump himself is religious https://t.co/8J4BuEauhH

name: politico
text: Our poll also shows just over a third of all Christians view the president as religious (50 percent do not) https://t.co/8J4BuEauhH

name: politico
text: Ideological conservatives and Republicans were the only demographics in our poll that had a majority of respondents who characterized the president as religious â€” 55 percent and 60 percent, respectively https://t.co/8J4BuEauhH

name: politico
text: The GOP has long been considered the party of law and order. But perhaps for the first time in decades, congressional Republicans are feeling pressure to act on police reforms. https://t.co/QUH54c7hC2
